alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 3:34PM EDT until July 16 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Sussex County in southern Delaware... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 334 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Lewes, Selbyville, Dagsboro, Millville, Henlopen Acres, Cape Henlopen State Park, Long Neck, Ocean View, Frankford, South Bethany, and Dewey Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
